content.description: Find the arch and crack splitting the middle of the wall. Climb cracks underneath arch and then bust over the arch itself. Hand cracks and some burly chimney moves lead to a nice ledge for a walk off around or rappel to the side back to packs.
content.protection: Doubles. A 6# cam could be useful but not needed
content.location: Behind the Nols practice area. Located in the guidebook, it is a northwest facing rock behind the prominent dome with stacked / balanced boulders seen from the campground.

content.description: From the right side of the ledge this route starts in the chimney. If you don't go too deep in the chimney the rock will stay good and you'll find gear. about 30' up, a crack breaks-out straight right under a roof. follow this crack another 30' straight right to a bolted anchor. A single rope rap will get you off and from the bolted anchor you can toprope Over-Torqued too.
content.protection: A single rack and stoppers is probably enough for this one.
content.location: This route is located on the far left side of the Main Wall. It is the 2nd route on the wall and it starts off of a ledge you need to scramble up to. Further left of the boulder/cave start of Over-torqued is a ramp that goes up and left. At the top of the ramp is a single 5.6 move to gain a ledge. some people might want to pitch this scramble out. This route starts on the right side of the ledge.

content.description: This route is super fun and varied and starts inside a cave formed by a boulder that leans against the Main Wall. We've actually climbed this route on hot days because the cliff goes into the shade early and there is a nice breeze that flows through the always shady cave.Chimney up through the cave to a gap in the top where you can pull through (10'). Gain the top of the boulder and turnaround to notice the bolts leading up the main wall to a crack with a bulge. The crack is a little grainy but takes good gear. Pull the bulge by using the crack, face holds and stems. once above the crux step left to a small ledge where you can clip the last bolt. the rock straight up the buttress is rotten. step left past the bolt towards the center of the wall where there is good alligator skin to find pro in. If you decide to not place pro and just run it to the anchor then that's ok too since its only 5.7 here but not placing gear on the upper face will make the route pg.
content.protection: single rack to #4 and stoppers. 3 bolts
content.location: This route starts towards the far left side of the Main Wall. Along the Main Wall there are 2 big boulders that lean against it creating caves to hide in. This route starts under the second one further left down the wall.

climbs.name: Heartwork
climbs.fa: Will McConaughy, Aaron Davis, Peter Powers

content.description: This line surmounts the other, less obvious, and more hidden tower around the backside of the Fist Pinnacle area, aka 2020 Tower. Start at the edge of the arete with some moderate climbing, plugging in some gear along the way while aiming for the blocky overhanging corner. Don't be intimidated by the fragile looking corner, as it's quite solid and takes passive gear well. After passing around the corner, clip the bolt and trend left using a flake and edges. You'll be traversing under the huge roof aiming for the ledge up high. From the ledge, clip bolt and pull the crux into cruiser alligator plates to the bolted anchor!
content.protection:
2 Bolts   Nuts   Single rack to #2   Rap Anchors at top 

  Bring alpine draws!
content.location: Walk the span of the main wall, ducking through the narrow passage at the beginning of Over-Torqued. Here you will cross a slanted slab and see a narrow 4th class/5-easy ramp system leading up to 2020 Tower. Set up either underneath the ramp system, or take the ramp system to a big ledge at the base of another narrow passage formed by the tower.

content.description: The Main Wall is situated right behind The Fist Pinnacle. This wall at its tallest is about 125' and hosts a good variety of interesting trad climbs. You can climb over an arch on one climb, climb a splitter, start in a chimney to a hole where you pop out onto a boulder! The Main Wall is pretty great!
